intro: Hedyotis ampliflora, commonly known as the broadleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance. Hedyotis ampliflora is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
